contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{chinese name|[[Xu (surname)|Xu]]}} {{Infobox volleyball player | name = Xu Linyin | image = | fullname = Xu Linyin | nickname = Tiny<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/sport/feedarticle/7676817 Beach volleyball-U.S., Brazil in battle of the bronzed], [[guardian.co.uk]], 25 July 2008</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1986|03|20}} | birth_place = [[Shanghai]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | death_date = | death_place = | hometown = [[Hebei]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | height = {{convert|200|cm|ftin|abbr=on}} | weight = |currentteammate=[[Penggen Wu]] | years = | teammates = [[Qiang Xu]] |tours (points)= 20 (488) | resultyears = | location = | result = | updated = }} '''Xu Linyin''' (born 20 March 1986 in [[Shanghai]]) is a [[China|Chinese]] professional [[beach volleyball]] player. == Career == Nicknamed "Tiny" because of his length, Xu Linyin stands 6 feet 7 inches tall. He headed into the [[Beach volleyball at the 2008 Summer Olympics|2008 Olympics]] as the #1 seed with his teammate [[Penggen Wu]]. They placed 5th in the [[FIVB]] Beach Volleyball Olympic Ranking, but were #1 seed because of FIVB regulations.<ref>[http://www.fivb.org/en/Infomedia/PressReleaseDB.asp?No=17738&Language=0 FIVB announces final Olympic Ranking for men’s and women’s Olympic Beach Volleyball tournaments], [[FIVB]]</ref> On 14 June 2010, Xu Linyin and partner [[Wu Penggen]] bested the Olympic Champions from USA [[Todd Rogers]] and [[Phil Dalhausser]] 21-17, 17-21 and 17-15 to win the Gold at the FIVB World Tour in Moscow.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sports/2010-06/15/c_13351143.htm |title=China upset US to grab men's title at FIVB World Tour |publisher=News.xinhuanet.com |date=15 June 2010 |accessdate=18 August 2012}}</ref> This was the first time China won the title in the men's event in the 24-year history of the international Beach Volleyball circuit. The duo of Xu and Wu continued their extraordinary performance with a second Gold on the FIVB World Tour in Marseille, France on 25 July 2010,<ref>[http://www.universalsports.com/news/article/newsid=484841.html ]{{dead link|date=August 2012}}</ref> and ended the season ranked 4th overall on the [[FIVB Beach Volleyball World Rankings]]. ==See also== *[[China at the 2012 Summer Olympics#Volleyball]] *[[Beach volleyball at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.bvbinfo.com/player.asp?ID=5352 Linyin Xu - Profile] at the [[Beach Volleyball Database]] {{s-start}} {{s-ach|aw}} {{succession box|before={{flagathlete|[[Phil Dalhausser]]|USA}}|title=[[Swatch FIVB World Tour|Men's FIVB Beach World Tour "Most Improved"]]|years=2007|after={{flagathlete|[[Andy Cès]]|FRA}} }} {{succession box|before={{flagathlete|[[Harley Marques Silva|Harley Marques]]|BRA}}|title=[[Swatch FIVB World Tour|Men's FIVB Beach World Tour "Most Inspirational"]]|years=2010|after={{flagathlete|[[Emanuel Rego]]|BRA}} }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Xu, Linyin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese volleyball player | DATE OF BIRTH =20 March 1986 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Shanghai]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xu, Linyin}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Beach volleyball players at the 2008 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Beach volleyball players at the 2012 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic beach volleyball players of China]] [[Category:Volleyball players from Shanghai]] [[de:Xu Linyin]] {{PRChina-volleyball-bio-stub}}
